intro: Lessingianthus bellulus, commonly known as the dwarf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Lessingianthus. It is a herbaceous annual that grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its compact size and vibrant blooms, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
